Author: jl777c#5810
Content: actually BTC devs are VERY active in doing their best to make life hard for all the other coins. first they made the segwit abomination, which made me abandon iguana from being a BTC node as there was no way I was supporting that and if it didnt do BTC, then it really wasnt worth maintaining its full node functionality (though my guess is that it still works find with stable codebase coins)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then they start randomly changing existing rpc calls, BREAKING existing apps

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is a big giant no-no. just ask linus what he things about kernel changes that break userspace

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but legacy devs were not satisfied...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they decided to go after all the most commonly used rpc calls to ensure that not just some bitcoin apps broke but all of them did

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they were nice enough to totally change the behavior of an existing rpc call and then make a new rpc with the old functionality

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes. you read that correctly. instead of keeping the old rpc the same and making the new functionality have a new name (sane and backward compatible) the broke all programs that used getinfo, validateaddress, signrawtransaction, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you would think that is enough

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nope

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now they are totally changing the addresses to a new format

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so BTC 0.14 or 0.15 is what i still use and probably will use for the forseeable future as that is the pre-segwit insanity

Content: @jl777c  why did you adapt c-lightning and not another implementation od LN such as LND ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I know C, not the other languages

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I understand, I have more or less the same problem (that's why I played with clightning before LND)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I hope that LND new features (out of LN specs) will be added into LN specs then into clightning and other implementations (PR 2455 of LND allows to pay without receiving an invoice first) as they said. Thank you for your hard work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we only use LN in a hub and spoke topology, to avoid most all its issues

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but considering how important it is supposed to be for BTC, it is surprising how many issues it still has

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I was not surprised that Liquid (product of blockstream) already contains the future features of LN (some are already implementated into LND but not into clightning). Good thing here is that the implementations of LN competes with each other

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I'll read more about CHIPS and how it works, thank you for your help

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but they have to interoperate, so the least common denominator is what matters

Author: phm87#7395
Content: yes of course, they contains interroperability tests to be sure to work with each other. But it is not forbidden to go beyond the specs. As example, clightning allows to make 1 channel between 2 nodes and make one funding of it while LND allows to have several channels between 2 nodes (and they want to be able to make several fundings of the same channel)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: but big enhancements (such as PR 2455 of LND) should be added into LN specs (if everyone agrees on it) then all implementations should offer the feature (I hope)
